JSRDotNETSDK Reference

PulserSettingInfo Properties

PulserSettingInfo Class  See Also

The following tables list the members exposed by the PulserSettingInfo type.

Properties
Name Description
AccessType Some settings like TriggerEnable are always accessed directly, such as pulser.TriggerEnable = true; Others, maybe accessed as an index, such as LowPassFilterIndex=0; This property indicates whether the setting can be accessed directly or by index or both.
AttributeFlags Gets the attribute flags for the setting. The bit definitions can be found in the SettingAttributes class.
DataType Gets the data type of the setting. Note this is for the setting. For example, even though the GainIndex property is an integer, the setting itself has the type of double.
DirectValue Gets or sets the index value. Reading or writing to this property will call into the instrument plugin
DirectValueMax Gets the direct value maximum.
DirectValueMin Gets the direct value minimum.
DirectValueNumerator Gets the direct value numerator in the case where the direct value is a fraction denominator. This is used for values such as the Pulse Rate Frequency, where the value to display is NUMERATOR / DIRECT_VALUE. For example, if the DIRECT_VALUE is 1000 and the NUMERATOR is 12000, the value to display is 12000/1000 or 12. If null is returned, then this setting is not represented by a fraction but the true direct value.
DirectValueStepSize Gets the size of the direct value step.
DirectValueStepSupported Gets a value indicating whether the direct value step supported.
EnumValues Gets the enum values.
IndexMax Gets or sets the index value.
IndexValue Gets or sets the index value. Reading or writing to this property will call into the instrument plugin.
IndexValues Gets or sets the index value.
IsDirectPresentAndSupported Gets a value indicating whether this setting is direct present and supported. If this is true for a setting named 'Gain', then pulser.Gain = 10.0; can be used.
IsFactory If this is try the property can not be written after the instrument leaves the factory.
IsIndexedPresentAndSupported Gets a value indicating whether this setting is indexed present and supported. So for Gain, this means that gain can be changed with statements like pulser.GainIndex = 0;
IsNumeratorSupported Gets whether or not the numerator value is provided for the DirectValue.
IsReadOnly Gets a value indicating whether this setting is read only.
IsVolatile Gets a value indicating whether this object is volatile, meaning that the current value may change spontaneously or as a result of changing a different setting. For example, EnergyPerPulse will change when the HVSupply setting is changed, therefore EnergyPerPulse would be volatile.
ListOfRoles Gets the list of roles that are present for this setting. Some settings have many properties associated with them, such as Index, IndexSupported and so on.
PropInfoRoles Gets the property information roles, including repeated properties with the role of SPECIFICVALUESUPPORTED with different indices.
PulserReceiverId Gets the identifier of the pulser receiver.
SettingName Gets the name of the setting. This is the name of the setting, not an individual property name. For example, a pulser property is HVSupplyIndex. The setting name is HVSupply.
Units Gets the units of measure for this setting. If it is a unit-less value, then PROPERTY_UNITS.UNIT_NONE will be returned.
Value Gets or sets the index value. Reading or writing to this property will call into the instrument plugin
Top
See Also
